name: correlator
sdkHandlingInfo: The correlator is a cache-buster and is automatically generated and managed by the SDK to prevent caching of ad requests.

name: output
sdkHandlingInfo: The output format is typically determined by the SDK based on its internal requirements and the API version being used. Manual modification is generally not recommended.

name: url
sdkHandlingInfo: The SDK automatically detects and passes the current page URL. Manual overriding might lead to incorrect reporting.

name: an
sdkHandlingInfo: For mobile app environments, the application name is typically retrieved by the SDK directly from the app's manifest or package information. Manual inclusion is usually redundant.

name: dth
sdkHandlingInfo: The SDK attempts to detect the device type automatically. While sometimes included, it's often more accurately set by the SDK's internal logic.

name: msid
sdkHandlingInfo: The mobile session ID is managed by the SDK for tracking user sessions within an application. It's automatically generated and updated.

name: omid_p
sdkHandlingInfo: The Open Measurement Interface Definition (OMID) Partner ID is set by the SDK when OMID is enabled, indicating the integration partner. It is crucial for correct OM measurement.

name: rdid
sdkHandlingInfo: The SDK automatically retrieves and passes the appropriate resettable device identifier based on platform capabilities and user privacy settings. Direct manipulation is discouraged.

name: wta
sdkHandlingInfo: If integrated, the SDK can manage the inclusion of web traffic auditing parameters based on configured settings. Manual addition is less common.

name: idtype
sdkHandlingInfo: This parameter is automatically set by the SDK to indicate the type of 'rdid' being sent, ensuring correct interpretation of the device identifier.

name: is_lat
sdkHandlingInfo: The SDK automatically determines and passes the 'Limit Ad Tracking' (LAT) status based on the user's device privacy settings. Manual inclusion is typically not needed.

name: pvid
sdkHandlingInfo: The PVID is often managed by the SDK to provide a unique identifier for a given page view or content session, aiding in analytics and frequency capping.

name: pvid_s
sdkHandlingInfo: Similar to pvid, this parameter is internally managed by the SDK for reporting aggregated page view data.

name: sdk_apis
sdkHandlingInfo: The SDK automatically populates this parameter with the APIs it supports (e.g., 'VAST', 'VPAID', 'OMID') based on its capabilities and configuration. Manual intervention is rarely required.
